meanings.definition: To tire out or exhaust by excessive wear or exertion.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of playing outside, the children were outwearying and ready for bed.
meanings.sent2: The hikers were outwearying after climbing the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner joked that the race was outwearying enough to make even a cheetah tired.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending meetings at work were outwearying, draining all motivation from the employees.
meanings.sent5: The relentless sun beat down on the travelers, outwearying them as they trudged through the desert.
